required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biochemical Markers and 2 and 3D Ultrasound to ID Maternal & Fetal Complications
clinical_study.official_title: The Combination of Biochemical Markers and Two and Three Dimensional Ultrasound Using Geometric Morphometrics in the Identification of Congenital Anomalies and Maternal or Fetal Complications

brief_summary.textblock: Can a combination of prenatal screening blood tests, early ultrasound, and a 3D ultrasound of the fetal face at approximately 20 weeks gestation identify fetuses with congenital anomalies and predict maternal and fetal complications?

detailed_description.textblock: Pts will be consented upon presenting to the department for a comprehensive ultrasound.The 3D picture is the only part of the study that is not part of standard obstetrical care.

clinical_study.why_stopped: No safety issues. Need to rewrite protocol

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of geometric morphometric analysis of fetal brow to 10 soft markers
primary_outcome.description: In patients who have undergone step-wise sequential screening, how often will the evaluation of 10 midtrimester sonographic soft markers of aneuploidy such that the recommendation regarding invasive diagnostic testing be changed?

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women presenting for a comprehensive ultrasound at approximately 20 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women at approximately 20 weeks
- ages 18-50
- singleton pregnancy
- plans to deliver at North Shore University Hosp
- completed step-wise sequential screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- multifetal gestation
- minors
- patients who have undergone diagnostic genetic testing
- incarcerated patients
- intention to deliver at a hospital other than North Shore University hosp
